cards.name: Bulbasaur
cards.text: While it is young, it uses the nutrients that are stored in the seed on its back in order to grow.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Ivysaur
cards.text: Exposure to sunlight adds to its strength. Sunlight also makes the bud on its back grow larger.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Venusaur ex

abilities.name: Tranquil Flower
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may heal 60 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dangerous Toxwhip
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

cards.name: Charmander
cards.text: From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to go out.

attacks.name: Blazing Destruction
attacks.text: Discard a Stadium in play.

cards.name: Charmeleon
cards.text: If it becomes agitated during battle, it spouts intense flames, incinerating its surroundings.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Charizard ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Brave Wing
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 100 more damage.

attacks.name: Explosive Vortex
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Squirtle
cards.text: When it feels threatened, it draws its limbs inside its shell and sprays water from its mouth.

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks.

cards.name: Wartortle
cards.text: It cleverly controls its furry ears and tail to maintain its balance while swimming.

attacks.name: Free Diving
attacks.text: Put up to 3 Basic Water Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.

cards.name: Blastoise ex

abilities.name: Solid Shell
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Twin Cannons
attacks.text: Discard up to 2 Basic Water Energy cards from your hand. This attack does 140 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

cards.name: Caterpie
cards.text: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

attacks.name: Leaf Munch
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Grass Pokémon, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Metapod
cards.text: Even though it is encased in a sturdy shell, the body inside is tender. It can't withstand a harsh attack.

attacks.name: Defensive Posture
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks.

cards.name: Butterfree
cards.text: It collects honey every day. It rubs honey onto the hairs on its legs to carry it back to its nest.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Bye-Bye Flight
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. Shuffle that Pokémon and all attached cards into their deck, and then shuffle this Pokémon and all attached cards into your deck. If your opponent has no Benched Pokémon, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Weedle
cards.text: Its poison stinger is very powerful. Its bright-colored body is intended to warn off its enemies.

cards.name: Kakuna

abilities.name: Cocoon Cover
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks used by your opponent's Pokémon done to this Pokémon. (Damage is not an effect.)

cards.text: While awaiting evolution, it hides from predators under leaves and in nooks of branches.

cards.name: Beedrill
cards.text: May appear in a swarm. Flies at violent speeds, all the while stabbing with the toxic stinger on its rear.

attacks.name: Nadir Needle
attacks.text: If you have no cards in your hand, this attack does 120 more damage, and your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

cards.name: Pidgey
cards.text: It is docile and prefers to avoid conflict. If disturbed, however, it can ferociously strike back.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Pidgeotto
cards.text: Very protective of its sprawling territorial area, this Pokémon will fiercely peck at any intruder.

cards.name: Pidgeot
cards.text: It spreads its gorgeous wings widely to intimidate enemies. It races through the skies at Mach-2 speed.

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Rattata
cards.text: This Pokémon is common but hazardous. Its sharp incisors can easily cut right through hard wood.

attacks.name: Gnaw the Wound
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Raticate
cards.text: Its whiskers are essential for maintaining its balance. No matter how friendly you are, it will get angry and bite you if you touch its whiskers.

attacks.name: Second Bite
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Spearow

abilities.name: Evolutionary Advantage
abilities.text: If you go second, this Pokémon can evolve during your first turn.

cards.text: Due to its short wings, it can't fly long distances. It wanders about restlessly and pecks at bug Pokémon.

cards.name: Fearow
cards.text: Carrying food through Fearow's territory is dangerous. It will snatch the food away from you in a flash!

attacks.name: Beak Catch
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Ekans
cards.text: The eggs of bird Pokémon are its favorite food. It swallows eggs whole, so sometimes an egg gets stuck, and Ekans faints.

attacks.name: Acid Spray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Arbok ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Bind Down
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Menacing Fangs
attacks.text: Your opponent discards 2 cards from their hand.

cards.name: Pikachu
cards.text: When it is angered, it immediately discharges the energy stored in the pouches in its cheeks.

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Lightning Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Raichu

abilities.name: Electrical Grounding
abilities.text: When 1 of your Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, you may move a Lightning Energy from that Pokémon to this Pokémon.

cards.text: Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

cards.name: Sandshrew

abilities.name: Sand Screen
abilities.text: Trainer cards in your opponent's discard pile can't be put into their deck by an effect of your opponent's Item or Supporter cards.

cards.text: It burrows into the ground to create its nest. If hard stones impede its tunneling, it uses its sharp claws to shatter them and then carries on digging.

cards.name: Sandslash
cards.text: It climbs trees by hooking on with its sharp claws. Sandslash shares the berries it gathers, dropping them down to Sandshrew waiting below the tree.

attacks.name: Rumble
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Spike Rend
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 100 more damage.

cards.name: Nidoran ♀
cards.text: It uses its hard incisor teeth to crush and eat berries. The tip of a female Nidoran's horn is a bit more rounded than the tip of a male's horn.

attacks.name: Poison Horn
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Nidorina
cards.text: If the group is threatened, these Pokémon will band together to assault enemies with a chorus of ultrasonic waves.

attacks.name: Fetch Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Nidoqueen
cards.text: It pacifies offspring by placing them in the gaps between the spines on its back. The spines will never secrete poison while young are present.

attacks.name: Queen Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Basic Pokémon.

cards.name: Nidoran ♂
cards.text: Small but brave, this Pokémon will hold its ground and even risk its life in battle to protect the female it's friendly with.

cards.name: Nidorino
cards.text: It's nervous and quick to act aggressively. The potency of its poison increases along with the level of adrenaline present in its body.

cards.name: Nidoking

abilities.name: Enthusiastic King
abilities.text: If you have Nidoqueen in play, ignore all Energy in the costs of attacks used by this Pokémon.

cards.text: Nidoking prides itself on its strength. It's forceful and spirited in battle, making use of its thick tail and diamond-crushing horn.

attacks.name: Venomous Impact
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Clefairy
cards.text: Its adorable behavior and cry make it highly popular. However, this cute Pokémon is rarely found.

attacks.name: Moon-Viewing Invitation
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Clefairy and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Clefable
cards.text: Their ears are sensitive enough to hear a pin drop from over a mile away, so they're usually found in quiet places.

attacks.name: Follow Me
attacks.text: Switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot.

attacks.name: More Moon
attacks.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, take 1 more Prize card.

cards.name: Vulpix
cards.text: As each tail grows, its fur becomes more lustrous. When held, it feels slightly warm.

attacks.name: Super Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Ninetales ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Heat Wave
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Mirrored Flames
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 140 more damage.

cards.name: Jigglypuff
cards.text: When its huge eyes waver, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.

attacks.name: Lead
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Stompy Stomp
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Wigglytuff ex

abilities.name: Expanding Body
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Special Energy attached, it gets +100 HP.

cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Friend Tackle
attacks.text: If you played a Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

cards.name: Zubat

abilities.name: Revealing Echo
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may have your opponent reveal their hand.

cards.text: Zubat live in caves, down where the sun's light won't reach. In the morning, they gather together to keep each other warm as they sleep.

cards.name: Golbat
cards.text: Its feet are tiny, but this Pokémon walks skillfully. It sneaks up on sleeping prey before sinking in its fangs and slurping up blood.

attacks.name: Skill Dive
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Oddish
cards.text: During the day, it stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.

cards.name: Gloom

abilities.name: Semi-Blooming Energy
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may look at the top 3 cards of your deck and attach any number of Basic Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

cards.text: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.

cards.name: Vileplume

abilities.name: Fully Blooming Energy
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may look at the top 8 cards of your deck and attach any number of Basic Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

cards.text: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

cards.name: Paras
cards.text: The mushrooms, known as tochukaso, are controlling the bug. Even if the bug bugs the mushrooms, they tell it to bug off.

attacks.name: Spore Ball
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Parasect
cards.text: The bug is mostly dead, with the mushroom on its back having become the main body. If the mushroom comes off, the bug stops moving.

attacks.name: Spread Filaments
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. Search your deck for a number of Grass Pokémon up to the number of heads and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Venonat
cards.text: Poison oozes from all over its body. It catches small bug Pokémon at night that are attracted by light.

cards.name: Venomoth
cards.text: The wings are covered with dustlike scales. Every time it flaps its wings, it looses highly toxic dust.

attacks.name: Perplexing Powder
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused. During your opponent's next turn, they can't play any Item cards from their hand.

cards.name: Diglett
cards.text: It lives about one yard underground, where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears aboveground.

cards.name: Dugtrio
cards.text: Its three heads bob separately up and down to loosen the soil nearby, making it easier for it to burrow.

cards.name: Meowth
cards.text: All it does is sleep during the daytime. At night, it patrols its territory with its eyes aglow.

attacks.name: Come Here Right Meow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, switch in 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon to the Active Spot.

cards.name: Persian

abilities.name: Rocket Call
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for a Giovanni's Charisma card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.text: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.

cards.name: Psyduck
cards.text: It is constantly wracked by a headache. When the headache turns intense, it begins using mysterious powers.

attacks.name: Overthink
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever they flip a coin, treat it as tails.

cards.name: Golduck
cards.text: When it swims at full speed using its long, webbed limbs, its forehead somehow begins to glow.

attacks.name: Aquatic Rescue
attacks.text: Put up to 4 Pokémon from your discard pile into your hand.

cards.name: Mankey
cards.text: It lives in groups in the treetops. If it loses sight of its group, it becomes infuriated by its loneliness.

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Primeape
cards.text: It becomes wildly furious if it even senses someone looking at it. It chases anyone that meets its glare.

attacks.name: Rant and Rave
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Raging Smash
attacks.text: If this Pokémon isn't Confused, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Growlithe
cards.text: It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.

attacks.name: Vaporize
attacks.text: Discard a Water Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Arcanine
cards.text: An ancient picture scroll shows that people were captivated by its movement as it ran through prairies.

attacks.name: Torrid Torrent
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Basic Fire Energy cards from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dynamite Fang
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Poliwag
cards.text: In rivers with fast-flowing water, this Pokémon will cling to a rock by using its thick lips, which act like a suction cup.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Poliwhirl
cards.text: This Pokémon's sweat is a slimy mucus. When captured, Poliwhirl can slither from its enemies' grasp and escape.

attacks.name: Frog Hop
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Poliwrath
cards.text: Poliwrath is skilled at both swimming and martial arts. It uses its well-trained arms to dish out powerful punches.

attacks.name: Bubble Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Heroic Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 150 more damage.

cards.name: Abra
cards.text: Abra can teleport in its sleep. Apparently the more deeply Abra sleeps, the farther its teleportations go.

cards.name: Kadabra
cards.text: This Pokémon's telekinesis is immensely powerful. To prepare for evolution, Kadabra stores up psychic energy in the star on its forehead.

attacks.name: Teleportation Attack
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Alakazam ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Mind Jack
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dimensional Hand
attacks.text: This attack can be used even if this Pokémon is on the Bench.

cards.name: Machop
cards.text: Always brimming with power, it passes time by lifting boulders. Doing so makes it even stronger.

attacks.name: Mountain Mashing
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

cards.name: Machoke
cards.text: Its formidable body never gets tired. It helps people by doing work such as the moving of heavy goods.

attacks.name: Mountain Ramming
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

cards.name: Machamp

abilities.name: Guts
abilities.text: If this Pokémon would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, flip a coin. If heads, this Pokémon is not Knocked Out, and its remaining HP becomes 10.

cards.text: With four arms that react more quickly than it can think, it can execute many punches at once.

attacks.name: Mountain Chopping
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck.

cards.name: Bellsprout
cards.text: Its bud looks like a human face. Because of the bud, it is rumored to be a type of legendary mandrake plant.

attacks.name: Bind Down
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

cards.name: Weepinbell
cards.text: It spits out Poison Powder to immobilize the enemy and then finishes it with a spray of Acid.

cards.name: Victreebel
cards.text: Once ingested into this Pokémon's body, even the hardest object will melt into nothing.

attacks.name: Slow-Acting Acid
attacks.text: At the end of your opponent's next turn, put 12 damage counters on the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Tentacool
cards.text: This Pokémon is mostly made of water. A Tentacool out in the ocean is very hard to spot, because its body blends in with the sea.

cards.name: Tentacruel
cards.text: Its 80 tentacles can stretch and shrink freely. Tentacruel ensnares prey in a net of spread-out tentacles, delivering venomous stings to its catch.

attacks.name: Poisonous Whip
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Tentacular Panic
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 90 damage for each heads. If the first flip is tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Geodude
cards.text: It uses both hands to climb precipitous cliffs. People who see it in action have been known to take up bouldering.

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Graveler
cards.text: It travels by rolling down cliffs. If it falls into a river, it will explode with its last gasp.

attacks.name: Rock Cannon
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Golem ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dynamic Roll
attacks.text: During your next turn, attacks used by this Pokémon do 120 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Rock Blaster
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

cards.name: Ponyta
cards.text: If you've been accepted by Ponyta, its burning mane is mysteriously no longer hot to the touch.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

cards.name: Rapidash
cards.text: The fastest runner becomes the leader, and it decides the herd's pace and direction of travel.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Mach Turn
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Slowpoke
cards.text: It is incredibly slow and dopey. It takes five seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.

attacks.name: Sea Bathing
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon, and it recovers from all Special Conditions.

cards.name: Slowbro
cards.text: When a Slowpoke went hunting in the sea, its tail was bitten by a Shellder. That made it evolve into Slowbro.

attacks.name: Big Yawn
attacks.text: Both Active Pokémon are now Asleep.

attacks.name: Laid-Back Tackle
attacks.text: If this Pokémon evolved during this turn, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Magnemite
cards.text: The electromagnetic waves emitted by the units at the sides of its head expel antigravity, which allows it to float.

attacks.name: Big Explosion
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 60 damage to itself.

cards.name: Magneton
cards.text: Three Magnemite are linked by a strong magnetic force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.

attacks.name: Junk Magnet
attacks.text: Put up to 2 Item cards from your discard pile into your hand.

cards.name: Farfetch'd
cards.text: They use a plant stalk as a weapon, but not all of them use it in the same way. Several distinct styles of stalk fighting have been observed.

attacks.name: Package Deal
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

cards.name: Doduo
cards.text: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with a telepathic power.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Dodrio

abilities.name: Zooming Draw
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may put 1 damage counter on this Pokémon. If you do, draw a card.

cards.text: An odd species that is rarely found. The three heads respectively represent joy, sadness, and anger.

attacks.name: Ballistic Beak
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

cards.name: Seel
cards.text: Thanks to its thick fat, cold seas don't bother it at all, but it gets tired pretty easily in warm waters.

cards.name: Dewgong
cards.text: It sunbathes on the beach after meals. The rise in its body temperature helps its digestion.

attacks.name: Dual Splash
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Grimer
cards.text: Born from sludge, these Pokémon now gather in polluted places and increase the bacteria in their bodies.

attacks.name: Gummy Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's Retreat Cost is Colorless more.

cards.name: Muk
cards.text: It's thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.

attacks.name: Sticky Jail
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, attacks used by the Defending Pokémon cost Colorless more, and its Retreat Cost is Colorless more.

cards.name: Shellder
cards.text: It is encased in a shell that is harder than diamond. Inside, however, it is surprisingly tender.

attacks.name: Shell Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Cloyster
cards.text: Cloyster that live in seas with harsh tidal currents grow large, sharp spikes on their shells.

attacks.name: Protect Charge
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 80 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Gastly
cards.text: It wraps its opponent in its gas-like body, slowly weakening its prey by poisoning it through the skin.

cards.name: Haunter

abilities.name: Spirit Return
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may put a Supporter card from your opponent's discard pile into their hand.

cards.text: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.

cards.name: Gengar
cards.text: To steal the life of its target, it slips into the prey's shadow and silently waits for an opportunity.

attacks.name: Poltergeist
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. This attack does 50 damage for each Trainer card you find there.

attacks.name: Hollow Dive
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

cards.name: Onix
cards.text: It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by squirming and twisting its massive, rugged body.

attacks.name: Thumpalanche
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck. This attack does 80 damage for each Pokémon with a Retreat Cost of exactly 4 that you discarded in this way.

cards.name: Drowzee
cards.text: It remembers every dream it eats. It rarely eats the dreams of adults because children's are much tastier.

cards.name: Hypno

abilities.name: Here for Hypnosis
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may make your opponent's Active Pokémon Asleep.

cards.text: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of psi moves, such as Hypnosis and Confusion.

cards.name: Krabby
cards.text: If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.

attacks.name: Salt Water
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for up to 2 Basic Water Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Kingler
cards.text: Its oversized claw is very powerful, but when it's not in battle, the claw just gets in the way.

attacks.name: Hammer Arm
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

cards.name: Voltorb
cards.text: It rolls to move. If the ground is uneven, a sudden jolt from hitting a bump can cause it to explode.

attacks.name: Tumbling Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Electrode
cards.text: The more energy it charges up, the faster it gets. But this also makes it more likely to explode.

attacks.name: Bang Boom Chain
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may discard any number of Pokémon Tools from your Pokémon. This attack does 40 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

cards.name: Exeggcute
cards.text: These Pokémon get nervous when they're not in a group of six. The minute even one member of the group goes missing, Exeggcute become cowardly.

attacks.name: Ball Roll
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Exeggutor
cards.text: When they work together, Exeggutor's three heads can put out powerful psychic energy. Cloudy days make this Pokémon sluggish.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Cubone

abilities.name: Cheering Bone
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, attacks used by your Marowak do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: This Pokémon wears the skull of its deceased mother. Sometimes Cubone's dreams make it cry, but each tear Cubone sheds makes it stronger.

attacks.name: Hit Twice
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Marowak
cards.text: When this Pokémon evolved, the skull of its mother fused to it. Marowak's temperament also turned vicious at the same time.

attacks.name: Bone Throw
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Boundless Power
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Hitmonlee
cards.text: The legs freely contract and stretch. The stretchy legs allow it to hit a distant foe with a rising kick.

attacks.name: Twister Kick
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Hitmonchan

abilities.name: Counterattack
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 3 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

cards.text: Its punches slice the air. However, it seems to need a short break after fighting for three minutes.

attacks.name: Excited Punch
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Excited Punch attack does 60 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Lickitung
cards.text: Bug Pokémon are Lickitung's main food source. This Pokémon paralyzes its prey with a lick from its long tongue, then swallows the prey whole.

attacks.name: Tongue-Tied
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Koffing
cards.text: Its body is full of poisonous gas. It floats into garbage dumps, seeking out the fumes of raw, rotting trash.

attacks.name: Suspicious Gas
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Weezing

abilities.name: Let's Have a Blast
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your opponent's Pokémon, flip a coin. If heads, the Attacking Pokémon is Knocked Out.

cards.text: Very rarely, a sudden mutation can result in two small Koffing twins becoming conjoined as a Weezing.

attacks.name: Spinning Fumes
attacks.text: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Rhyhorn
cards.text: It can remember only one thing at a time. Once it starts rushing, it forgets why it started.

attacks.name: Push Down
attacks.text: Switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

cards.name: Rhydon
cards.text: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Charismatic Drill
attacks.text: If you played Giovanni's Charisma from your hand during this turn, this attack does 140 more damage.

cards.name: Chansey

abilities.name: Lucky Bonus
abilities.text: If you took this Pokémon as a face-down Prize card during your turn and your Bench isn't full, before you put it into your hand, you may put it onto your Bench. If you put this Pokémon onto your Bench in this way, flip a coin. If heads, take 1 more Prize card.

cards.text: This kindly Pokémon lays highly nutritious eggs and shares them with injured Pokémon or people.

cards.name: Tangela
cards.text: Hidden beneath a tangle of vines that grows nonstop even if the vines are torn off, this Pokémon's true appearance remains a mystery.

attacks.name: Tactful Tangling
attacks.text: If you played Erika's Invitation from your hand during this turn, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Kangaskhan ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Triple Draw
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Incessant Punching
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 100 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Horsea
cards.text: They swim with dance-like motions and cause whirlpools to form. Horsea compete to see which of them can generate the biggest whirlpool.

cards.name: Seadra
cards.text: Seadra's mouth is slender, but its suction power is strong. In an instant, Seadra can suck in food that's larger than the opening of its mouth.

attacks.name: Blinding Ink
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if the Defending Pokémon tries to use an attack, your opponent flips 2 coins. If either of them is tails, that attack doesn't happen.

cards.name: Goldeen
cards.text: Its dorsal and pectoral fins are strongly developed like muscles. It can swim at a speed of five knots.

attacks.name: Triple Strike
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Seaking
cards.text: Using its horn, it bores holes in riverbed boulders, making nests to prevent its eggs from washing away.

attacks.name: Swim Freely
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aqua Horn
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Staryu
cards.text: Fish Pokémon nibble at it, but Staryu isn't bothered. Its body regenerates quickly, even if part of it is completely torn off.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance, or by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Starmie

abilities.name: Mysterious Comet
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If you placed any damage counters in this way, discard this Pokémon and all attached cards.

cards.text: Starmie swims by spinning its body at high speed. As this Pokémon cruises through the ocean, it absorbs tiny plankton.

cards.name: Mr. Mime

abilities.name: Mimic Barrier
abilities.text: If this Pokémon and your opponent's Active Pokémon have the same amount of Energy attached, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.text: It's known for its top-notch pantomime skills. It protects itself from all sorts of attacks by emitting auras from its fingers to create walls.

attacks.name: Psypower
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

cards.name: Scyther
cards.text: It slashes through grass with its sharp scythes, moving too fast for the human eye to track.

attacks.name: Helpful Slash
attacks.text: Attach a Basic Grass Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Jynx ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Heart-Stopping Kiss
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Asleep, it is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Electabuzz
cards.text: With the coming of a storm, many of these Pokémon will gather under tall trees and sit there waiting for lightning to strike.

attacks.name: Electro Combo
attacks.text: If Magmar is on your Bench, this attack does 40 more damage.

cards.name: Magmar
cards.text: These Pokémon's bodies are constantly burning. Magmar are feared as one of the causes behind fires.

attacks.name: Flare Combo
attacks.text: If Electabuzz is on your Bench, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Pinsir
cards.text: This Pokémon clamps its pincers down on its prey and then either splits the prey in half or flings it away.

attacks.name: Reckless Throw
attacks.text: If you have more Prize cards remaining than your opponent, this attack does 90 more damage.

cards.name: Tauros
cards.text: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.

attacks.name: Gather the Crew
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

cards.name: Magikarp
cards.text: An underpowered, pathetic Pokémon. It may jump high on rare occasions but never more than seven feet.

attacks.name: Splashy Splash
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, draw a card.

cards.name: Gyarados

abilities.name: Untamed One
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you must discard the top 5 cards of your deck.

cards.text: Once it appears, it goes on a rampage. It remains enraged until it demolishes everything around it.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Lapras
cards.text: Crossing icy seas is no issue for this cold-resistant Pokémon. Its smooth skin is a little cool to the touch.

attacks.name: Hop on My Back
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Ditto

abilities.name: Transformative Start
abilities.text: Once during your first turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may search your deck and choose a Basic Pokémon you find there, except any Ditto. If you do, discard this Pokémon and all attached cards, and put the chosen Pokémon in its place. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.text: Its transformation ability is perfect. However, if made to laugh, it can't maintain its disguise.

cards.name: Eevee
cards.text: Its ability to evolve into many forms allows it to adapt smoothly and perfectly to any environment.

attacks.name: Colorful Friends
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Pokémon of different types, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Vaporeon
cards.text: It lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with a fin, which is often mistaken for a mermaid's.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fighting Whirlpool
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon ex or Pokémon V, this attack does 90 more damage.

cards.name: Jolteon
cards.text: It concentrates the weak electric charges emitted by its cells and launches wicked lightning bolts.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Fighting Lightning
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon ex or Pokémon V, this attack does 90 more damage.

cards.name: Flareon
cards.text: Inhaled air is carried to its flame sac, heated, and exhaled as fire that reaches over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Destructive Flame
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fighting Blaze
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon ex or Pokémon V, this attack does 90 more damage.

cards.name: Porygon
cards.text: In recent years, this species has been very helpful in cyberspace. These Pokémon will go around checking to make sure no suspicious data exists.

attacks.name: Conversion 4
attacks.text: Choose Grass, Fire, Water, Lightning, Psychic, Fighting, Darkness, Metal, or Dragon type. Until the Defending Pokémon leaves the Active Spot, its Weakness is now that type. (The amount of Weakness doesn't change.)

cards.name: Omanyte
cards.text: This Pokémon is a member of an ancient, extinct species. Omanyte paddles through water with its 10 tentacles, looking like it's just drifting along.

attacks.name: Tentacular Return
attacks.text: Put an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon into their hand.

cards.name: Omastar

abilities.name: Primordial Tentacles
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent's Active Pokémon can't retreat.

cards.text: Omastar's sharp fangs could crush rock, but the Pokémon can attack only the prey that come within reach of its tentacles.

attacks.name: Aqua Split
attacks.text: This attack also does 30 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Kabuto
cards.text: While some say this species has gone extinct, Kabuto sightings are apparently fairly common in some places.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 70 damage for each heads.

cards.name: Kabutops

abilities.name: Ancient Way
abilities.text: Apply Weakness for your opponent's Active Pokémon as ×4 instead.

cards.text: The cause behind the extinction of this species is unknown. Kabutops were aggressive Pokémon that inhabited warm seas.

attacks.name: Draining Blade
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Aerodactyl
cards.text: Aerodactyl's sawlike fangs can shred skin to tatters—even the skin of Steel-type Pokémon.

attacks.name: Devolution Ray
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is an evolved Pokémon, devolve it by putting the highest Stage Evolution card on it into your opponent's hand.

cards.name: Snorlax

abilities.name: Voraciousness
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may put up to 2 Leftovers cards from your discard pile into your hand.

cards.text: This Pokémon's stomach is so strong, even eating moldy or rotten food will not affect it.

attacks.name: Thudding Press
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Articuno

abilities.name: Ice Float
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Water Energy attached, it has no Retreat Cost.

cards.text: This Pokémon can control ice at will. Articuno is said to live in snowy mountains riddled with permafrost.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Zapdos ex

abilities.name: Voltaic Float
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Lightning Energy attached, it has no Retreat Cost.

cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Multishot Lightning
attacks.text: This attack also does 90 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Moltres

abilities.name: Flare Float
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Fire Energy attached, it has no Retreat Cost.

cards.text: There are stories of this Pokémon using its radiant, flame-cloaked wings to light up paths for those lost in the mountains.

attacks.name: Blazing Flight
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Dratini
cards.text: It sheds many layers of skin as it grows larger. During this process, it is protected by a rapid waterfall.

cards.name: Dragonair
cards.text: They say that if it emits an aura from its whole body, the weather will begin to change instantly.

attacks.name: Aqua Slash
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Dragonite

abilities.name: Jet Cruise
abilities.text: Your Pokémon in play have no Retreat Cost.

cards.text: It is said that somewhere in the ocean lies an island where these gather. Only they live there.

attacks.name: Dragon Pulse
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck.

cards.name: Mewtwo
cards.text: A Pokémon created by recombining Mew's genes. It's said to have the most savage heart among Pokémon.

attacks.name: Reflective Barrier
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if it is Knocked Out), put damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon equal to the damage done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psyslash
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Mew ex

abilities.name: Restart
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may draw cards until you have 3 cards in your hand.

cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Genome Hacking
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

cards.name: Antique Dome Fossil

abilities.name: Domed Armor
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: Play this card as if it were a 60-HP Basic Colorless Pokémon. This card can't be affected by any Special Conditions and can't retreat.  At any time during your turn, you may discard this card from play.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Antique Helix Fossil

abilities.name: Helical Swell
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent can't play any Stadium cards from their hand.

cards.text: Play this card as if it were a 60-HP Basic Colorless Pokémon. This card can't be affected by any Special Conditions and can't retreat.  At any time during your turn, you may discard this card from play.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Antique Old Amber

abilities.name: Amber Protection
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's Pokémon's Abilities done to this Pokémon.

cards.text: Play this card as if it were a 60-HP Basic Colorless Pokémon. This card can't be affected by any Special Conditions and can't retreat.  At any time during your turn, you may discard this card from play.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Big Air Balloon
cards.text: The Stage 2 Pokémon this card is attached to has no Retreat Cost.,You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

cards.name: Bill's Transfer
cards.text: Look at the top 8 cards of your deck. You may reveal any number of Pokémon you find there and put them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Cycling Road
cards.text: Once during each player's turn, that player may discard a Basic Energy card from their hand in order to draw a card.,You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

cards.name: Daisy's Help
cards.text: Draw 2 cards. Look at your face-down Prize cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Energy Sticker
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, attach a Basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Erika's Invitation
cards.text: Your opponent reveals their hand, and you put a Basic Pokémon you find there onto your opponent's Bench. If you put a Pokémon onto their Bench in this way, switch in that Pokémon to the Active Spot.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Giovanni's Charisma
cards.text: Put an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon into their hand. If you do, attach an Energy card from your hand to your Active Pokémon.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Grabber
cards.text: Your opponent reveals their hand, and you put a Pokémon you find there on the bottom of their deck.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

cards.name: Leftovers
cards.text: At the end of your turn, if the Pokémon this card is attached to is in the Active Spot, heal 20 damage from it.,You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

cards.name: Protective Goggles
cards.text: The Basic Pokémon this card is attached to has no Weakness.,You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

cards.name: Rigid Band
cards.text: The Stage 1 Pokémon this card is attached to takes 30 less damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance).,You may attach any number of Pokémon Tools to your Pokémon during your turn. You may attach only 1 Pokémon Tool to each Pokémon, and it stays attached.

cards.name: Bulbasaur
cards.text: While it is young, it uses the nutrients that are stored in the seed on its back in order to grow.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Ivysaur
cards.text: Exposure to sunlight adds to its strength. Sunlight also makes the bud on its back grow larger.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Charmander
cards.text: From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to go out.

attacks.name: Blazing Destruction
attacks.text: Discard a Stadium in play.

cards.name: Charmeleon
cards.text: If it becomes agitated during battle, it spouts intense flames, incinerating its surroundings.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Squirtle
cards.text: When it feels threatened, it draws its limbs inside its shell and sprays water from its mouth.

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks.

cards.name: Wartortle
cards.text: It cleverly controls its furry ears and tail to maintain its balance while swimming.

attacks.name: Free Diving
attacks.text: Put up to 3 Basic Water Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.

cards.name: Caterpie
cards.text: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

attacks.name: Leaf Munch
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Grass Pokémon, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Pikachu
cards.text: When it is angered, it immediately discharges the energy stored in the pouches in its cheeks.

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Lightning Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

cards.name: Nidoking

abilities.name: Enthusiastic King
abilities.text: If you have Nidoqueen in play, ignore all Energy in the costs of attacks used by this Pokémon.

cards.text: Nidoking prides itself on its strength. It's forceful and spirited in battle, making use of its thick tail and diamond-crushing horn.

attacks.name: Venomous Impact
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Psyduck
cards.text: It is constantly wracked by a headache. When the headache turns intense, it begins using mysterious powers.

attacks.name: Overthink
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever they flip a coin, treat it as tails.

cards.name: Poliwhirl
cards.text: This Pokémon's sweat is a slimy mucus. When captured, Poliwhirl can slither from its enemies' grasp and escape.

attacks.name: Frog Hop
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Machoke
cards.text: Its formidable body never gets tired. It helps people by doing work such as the moving of heavy goods.

attacks.name: Mountain Ramming
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

cards.name: Tangela
cards.text: Hidden beneath a tangle of vines that grows nonstop even if the vines are torn off, this Pokémon's true appearance remains a mystery.

attacks.name: Tactful Tangling
attacks.text: If you played Erika's Invitation from your hand during this turn, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Mr. Mime

abilities.name: Mimic Barrier
abilities.text: If this Pokémon and your opponent's Active Pokémon have the same amount of Energy attached, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.text: It's known for its top-notch pantomime skills. It protects itself from all sorts of attacks by emitting auras from its fingers to create walls.

attacks.name: Psypower
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

cards.name: Omanyte
cards.text: This Pokémon is a member of an ancient, extinct species. Omanyte paddles through water with its 10 tentacles, looking like it's just drifting along.

attacks.name: Tentacular Return
attacks.text: Put an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon into their hand.

cards.name: Dragonair
cards.text: They say that if it emits an aura from its whole body, the weather will begin to change instantly.

attacks.name: Aqua Slash
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.name: Venusaur ex

abilities.name: Tranquil Flower
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may heal 60 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dangerous Toxwhip
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

cards.name: Charizard ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Brave Wing
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 100 more damage.

attacks.name: Explosive Vortex
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Blastoise ex

abilities.name: Solid Shell
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Twin Cannons
attacks.text: Discard up to 2 Basic Water Energy cards from your hand. This attack does 140 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

cards.name: Arbok ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Bind Down
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Menacing Fangs
attacks.text: Your opponent discards 2 cards from their hand.

cards.name: Ninetales ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Heat Wave
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Mirrored Flames
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 140 more damage.

cards.name: Wigglytuff ex

abilities.name: Expanding Body
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Special Energy attached, it gets +100 HP.

cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Friend Tackle
attacks.text: If you played a Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

cards.name: Alakazam ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Mind Jack
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dimensional Hand
attacks.text: This attack can be used even if this Pokémon is on the Bench.

cards.name: Golem ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dynamic Roll
attacks.text: During your next turn, attacks used by this Pokémon do 120 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

cards.text: Draw 2 cards. Look at your face-down Prize cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Erika's Invitation
cards.text: Your opponent reveals their hand, and you put a Basic Pokémon you find there onto your opponent's Bench. If you put a Pokémon onto their Bench in this way, switch in that Pokémon to the Active Spot.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Giovanni's Charisma
cards.text: Put an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon into their hand. If you do, attach an Energy card from your hand to your Active Pokémon.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Venusaur ex

abilities.name: Tranquil Flower
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, you may heal 60 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dangerous Toxwhip
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

cards.name: Charizard ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Brave Wing
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 100 more damage.

attacks.name: Explosive Vortex
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Blastoise ex

abilities.name: Solid Shell
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Twin Cannons
attacks.text: Discard up to 2 Basic Water Energy cards from your hand. This attack does 140 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

cards.name: Alakazam ex
cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Mind Jack
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dimensional Hand
attacks.text: This attack can be used even if this Pokémon is on the Bench.

cards.name: Zapdos ex

abilities.name: Voltaic Float
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Lightning Energy attached, it has no Retreat Cost.

cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Multishot Lightning
attacks.text: This attack also does 90 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Erika's Invitation
cards.text: Your opponent reveals their hand, and you put a Basic Pokémon you find there onto your opponent's Bench. If you put a Pokémon onto their Bench in this way, switch in that Pokémon to the Active Spot.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Giovanni's Charisma
cards.text: Put an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon into their hand. If you do, attach an Energy card from your hand to your Active Pokémon.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

cards.name: Mew ex

abilities.name: Restart
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may draw cards until you have 3 cards in your hand.

cards.text: Pokémon ex rule: When your Pokémon ex is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Genome Hacking
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

cards.name: Switch
cards.text: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.,You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.
